flawed_nl_solution:
For every acre of grass, the farmer can harvest 560/5 = <<560/5=112>>112 bales of hay each month.
This year, the farmer has 7 + 5 = <<7+5=21>>21 acres of grass.
He can expect to harvest 21 x 112 = <<21*112=2352>>2352 bales of hay per month.
The total hay production this year is 2352*12 = <<2352*12=28224>>28224
From September to December, the farmer would have to feed his horses for a total of 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 = <<30+31+30+31=122>>122 days
Each day his horse eats a total of 3*9 = <<3*9=27>>27 bales of hay.
For the 122 days, the horses will eat a total of 27*122 = <<27*122=3294>>3294 bales.
The total number of bales remaining will be 28224-3294 = <<28224-3294=24930>>24930.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
